schema.description: A JSON Schema directive to bind a specific schema to its document instance.

system-security-plan.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18.

System-security-plan.title: System security plan
System-security-plan.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system security plan (SSP) elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the SSP can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

metadata.description: Provides information about the containing document, and defines concepts that are shared across the document.

import-profile.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

system-characteristics.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

system-implementation.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

control-implementation.description: Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

back-matter.description: A collection of resources that may be referenced from within the OSCAL document instance.

Import-profile.title: Import profile
Import-profile.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the profile or catalog to use as the system's control baseline.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

System-characteristics.title: System characteristics
System-characteristics.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

system-ids.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referencing an externally defined system identification, the system identification must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

system-name.description: The full name of the system.

system-name-short.description: A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

date-authorized.description: The date the system received its authorization.

security-sensitivity-level.description: The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by FIPS-199.

system-information.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

security-impact-level.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

status.description: Describes the operational status of the system.

authorization-boundary.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

network-architecture.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

data-flow.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

responsible-parties.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

System-information.title: System information
System-information.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

information-types.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

Information-type.title: Information type
Information-type.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in NIST SP 800-60.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this information type elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the information type can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

description.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

categorizations.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

confidentiality-impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

integrity-impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

availability-impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

Categorization.title: Categorization
Categorization.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

system.description: Specifies the information type identification system used.

information-type-ids.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier qualified by the given identification system used, such as NIST SP 800-60. This identifier has cross-instance scope and can be used to reference this system elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

Categorization$system.title: Categorization$system
Categorization$system.description: Specifies the information type identification system used.

Impact.title: Impact
Impact.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

base.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

selected.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

adjustment-justification.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

Adjustment-justification.title: Adjustment justification
Adjustment-justification.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

Security-impact-level.title: Security impact level
Security-impact-level.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

security-objective-confidentiality.description: A target-level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security-objective-integrity.description: A target-level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

security-objective-availability.description: A target-level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Describes the operational status of the system.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Authorization-boundary.title: Authorization boundary
Authorization-boundary.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

description.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

diagrams.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Diagram.title: Diagram
Diagram.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this diagram elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the diagram can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

caption.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Network-architecture.title: Network architecture
Network-architecture.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

description.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

diagrams.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Data-flow.title: Data flow
Data-flow.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

description.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

diagrams.description: A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

System-implementation.title: System implementation
System-implementation.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

leveraged-authorizations.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a common control provider.

users.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

components.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

inventory-items.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Leveraged-authorization.title: Leveraged authorization
Leveraged-authorization.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a common control provider.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope and can be used to reference this leveraged authorization elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the leveraged authorization can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

party-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the party that manages the leveraged system.

date-authorized.description: The date the system received its authorization.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Control-implementation.title: Control implementation
Control-implementation.description: Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

description.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

set-parameters.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

implemented-requirements.description: Describes how the system satisfies the requirements of an individual control.

Implemented-requirement.title: Implemented requirement
Implemented-requirement.description: Describes how the system satisfies the requirements of an individual control.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this control requirement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the control requirement can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

control-id.description: A reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

set-parameters.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

statements.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

by-components.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Statement.title: Statement
Statement.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

statement-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a control statement.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The UUID of the control statement in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

by-components.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

By-component.title: By component
By-component.description: Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to the component that is implemeting a given control.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this by-component entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the by-component entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

set-parameters.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

implementation-status.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

export.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

inherited.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

satisfied.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Inherited-item.title: Inherited item
Inherited-item.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inherited control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

provided-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

Satisfied-item.title: Satisfied item
Satisfied-item.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this satisfied control implementation entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

responsibility-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a control implementation that satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Metadata.title: Metadata
Metadata.description: Provides information about the containing document, and defines concepts that are shared across the document.

title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

published.description: The date and time the document was last made available.

last-modified.description: The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

version.description: Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

oscal-version.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

revisions.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document, expected to be in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest first).

document-ids.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

roles.description: Defines a function, which might be assigned to a party in a specific situation.

locations.description: A physical point of presence, which may be associated with people, organizations, or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

parties.description: An organization or person, which may be associated with roles or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

responsible-parties.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

actions.description: An action applied by a role within a given party to the content.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Revision.title: Revision
Revision.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document, expected to be in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest first).

title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

published.description: The date and time the document was last made available.

last-modified.description: The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

version.description: Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

oscal-version.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Role.title: Role
Role.description: Defines a function, which might be assigned to a party in a specific situation.

id.description: A unique identifier for the role.

title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Location.title: Location
Location.description: A physical point of presence, which may be associated with people, organizations, or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.description: A unique ID for the location, for reference.

title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

address.description: A postal address for the location.

email-addresses.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

telephone-numbers.description: A telephone service number as defined by ITU-T E.164.

urls.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or other resource associated with the location.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Party.title: Party
Party.description: An organization or person, which may be associated with roles or other concepts within the current or linked OSCAL document.

uuid.description: A unique identifier for the party.

type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

external-ids.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

email-addresses.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

telephone-numbers.description: A telephone service number as defined by ITU-T E.164.

addresses.description: A postal address for the location.

location-uuids.description: Reference to a location by UUID.

member-of-organizations.description: A reference to another party by UUID, typically an organization, that this subject is associated with.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Party$type.title: Party$type
Party$type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

External-id.title: External id
External-id.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

External-id$scheme.title: External id$scheme
External-id$scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

Back-matter.title: Back matter
Back-matter.description: A collection of resources that may be referenced from within the OSCAL document instance.

resources.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document instance. A resource may be directly included in the document using base64 encoding or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document instance. A resource may be directly included in the document using base64 encoding or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

uuid.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

title.description: An optional name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.description: An optional short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

document-ids.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme.

citation.description: An optional citation consisting of end note text using structured markup.

rlinks.description: A URL-based pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

base64.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by RFC 2045.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Base64-Resource.title: Base64 Resource
Base64-Resource.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by RFC 2045.

filename.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by RFC 2045.

media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

Rlink.title: Rlink
Rlink.description: A URL-based pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.description: A resolvable URL pointing to the referenced resource.

media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

hashes.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

Property.title: Property
Property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

name.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.description: A unique identifier for a property.

ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name.

group.description: An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

resource-fragment.description: In case where the href points to a back-matter/resource, this value will indicate the URI fragment to append to any rlink associated with the resource. This value MUST be URI encoded.

text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

Link$rel.title: Link$rel
Link$rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

Responsible-party.title: Responsible party
Responsible-party.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

role-id.description: A reference to a role performed by a party.

party-uuids.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Action.title: Action
Action.description: An action applied by a role within a given party to the content.

uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined action elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

date.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

type.description: The type of action documented by the assembly, such as an approval.

system.description: Specifies the action type system used.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-parties.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Responsible-role.title: Responsible role
Responsible-role.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a role performed.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

party-uuids.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Hash.title: Hash
Hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.description: The digest method by which a hash is derived.

Hash$algorithm.title: Hash$algorithm
Hash$algorithm.description: The digest method by which a hash is derived.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Telephone-number.title: Telephone number
Telephone-number.description: A telephone service number as defined by ITU-T E.164.

type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

Telephone-number$type.title: Telephone number$type
Telephone-number$type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

Address.title: Address
Address.description: A postal address for the location.

addr-lines.description: A single line of an address.

city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for a mailing address.

postal-code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address.

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

Document-id.title: Document id
Document-id.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme.

scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

Document-id$scheme.title: Document id$scheme
Document-id$scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

System-component.title: System component
System-component.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this component elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the component can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.description: A human readable name for the system component.

description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

status.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

responsible-roles.description: A reference to a role with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object, optionally associated with a set of persons and/or organizations that perform that role.

protocols.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

System-component$type.title: System component$type
System-component$type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

Protocol.title: Protocol
Protocol.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this service protocol information elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the service protocol can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

name.description: The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

title.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

port-ranges.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

Port-range.title: Port range
Port-range.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

start.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range

end.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range

Implementation-status.title: Implementation status
Implementation-status.description: Indicates the degree to which the a given control is implemented.

state.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Implementation-status$state.title: Implementation status$state
Implementation-status$state.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

System-user.title: System user
System-user.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this user class elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the system user can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

description.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

role-ids.description: Reference to a role by UUID.

authorized-privileges.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Authorized-privilege.title: Authorized privilege
Authorized-privilege.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

title.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

description.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

functions-performed.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

Inventory-item.title: Inventory item
Inventory-item.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inventory item elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inventory item can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

description.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-parties.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

implemented-components.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Implemented-component.title: Implemented component
Implemented-component.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

component-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

responsible-parties.description: A reference to a set of persons and/or organizations that have responsibility for performing the referenced role in the context of the containing object.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Set-parameter.title: Set parameter
Set-parameter.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

param-id.description: A human-oriented reference to a parameter within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

values.description: A parameter value or set of values.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

System-id.title: System id
System-id.description: A human-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referencing an externally defined system identification, the system identification must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

identifier-type.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

System-id$identifier-type.title: System id$identifier type
System-id$identifier-type.description: Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

Part.title: Part
Part.description: An annotated, markup-based textual element of a control's or catalog group's definition, or a child of another part.

id.description: A unique identifier for the part.

name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type, which exists in a value space qualified by the ns.

ns.description: An optional namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.description: An optional textual providing a sub-type or characterization of the part's name, or a category to which the part belongs.

title.description: An optional name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

parts.description: An annotated, markup-based textual element of a control's or catalog group's definition, or a child of another part.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

Parameter.title: Parameter
Parameter.description: Parameters provide a mechanism for the dynamic assignment of value(s) in a control.

id.description: A unique identifier for the parameter.

class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the type, purpose, use or scope of the parameter.

depends-on.description: (deprecated) Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

props.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

links.description: A reference to a local or remote resource, that has a specific relation to the containing object.

label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter.

constraints.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test.

guidelines.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

values.description: A parameter value or set of values.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Parameter-constraint.title: Parameter constraint
Parameter-constraint.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test.

description.description: A textual summary of the constraint to be applied.

tests.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

Test.title: Test
Test.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

expression.description: A formal (executable) expression of a constraint.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Parameter-guideline.title: Parameter guideline
Parameter-guideline.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

prose.description: Prose permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

how-many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

choice.description: A value selection among several such options.

Parameter-selection$how-many.title: Parameter selection$how many
Parameter-selection$how-many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

Choice1-item.title: Choice1 item
Choice1-item.description: A value selection among several such options.

Include-all.title: Include all
Include-all.description: Include all controls from the imported catalog or profile resources.

Base64Datatype.title: Base64Datatype
Base64Datatype.description: Binary data encoded using the Base 64 encoding algorithm as defined by RFC4648.

DateDatatype.title: DateDatatype
DateDatatype.description: A string representing a 24-hour period with an optional timezone.

DateTimeWithTimezoneDatatype.title: DateTimeWithTimezoneDatatype
DateTimeWithTimezoneDatatype.description: A string representing a point in time with a required timezone.

EmailAddressDatatype.title: EmailAddressDatatype
EmailAddressDatatype.description: An email address string formatted according to RFC 6531.

NonNegativeIntegerDatatype.title: NonNegativeIntegerDatatype
NonNegativeIntegerDatatype.description: An integer value that is equal to or greater than 0.

StringDatatype.title: StringDatatype
StringDatatype.description:
A non-empty string with leading and trailing whitespace disallowed. Whitespace is: U+9, U+10, U+32 or [ 
	]+

TokenDatatype.title: TokenDatatype
TokenDatatype.description: A non-colonized name as defined by XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition. https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#NCName.

URIDatatype.title: URIDatatype
URIDatatype.description: A universal resource identifier (URI) formatted according to RFC3986.

URIReferenceDatatype.title: URIReferenceDatatype
URIReferenceDatatype.description: A URI Reference, either a URI or a relative-reference, formatted according to section 4.1 of RFC3986.

UUIDDatatype.title: UUIDDatatype
UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.

Export.title: Export
Export.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the provided entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

remarks.description: Additional commentary about the containing object.

Control-implementation-responsibility.title: Control implementation responsibility
Control-implementation-responsibility.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

description.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this responsibility elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the responsibility can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

provided-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.
